text: At google protobuffer message field descriptions can be annotated with <https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/proto#options|options>, so then there are linters that check the service definition is not allowing public access to confidential fields. I think there was deeper support in some of the processing libraries to pass those flags along variables but I can't see anything equivalent in the public domain and they are not really foolproof anyway. I do think this is more of a metadata topic rather than a types topic though. gRPC can represent annotated datatypes, which might be a useful building block (?)
